title.bibl: Dziennik Chicagoski, Mar. 26, 1895. Miss Heller's Benefit Concert Nets Over Three Hundred Dollars

div.bibl: Dziennik Chicagoski, Mar. 26, 1895. MISS HELLER'S BENEFIT CONCERT NETS OVER THREE HUNDRED DOLLARS

body.p: According to private information received, the net income from Miss Mira Heller's benefit concert, staged Sunday, March 24, at the Polish Hall, for the destitute Poles of Nebraska and the Polish Hospital of Chicago, amounted to three hundred and thirty dollars. The addition to this of the three hundred dollars donated by the Reszke brothers brings the total to six hundred and thirty dollars.
The gross receipts amounted to three hundred and ninety dollars, of which sixty went toward expenses.
In this way the Polish hospital received over three hundred dollars, and the destitute Poles of Nebraska, who have been hard hit by the depression, received a like sum.
An official statement will be published soon.
